@graph.name: Sichuan Shrimp Stir Fry - Omnivore's Cookbook
@graph.description: Authentic Chinese restaurant-style Sichuan shrimp stir fry delivers a crispy texture, richly aromatic, and utterly divine flavor.

@graph.caption: Stir fried shrimp accented with bright pop of Sichuan flavor: chile pepper, tingly peppercorn, and a dose of umami will just dazzle your taste buds.

@graph.name: Maggie Zhu
@graph.description: Hi I'm Maggie Zhu! Welcome to my site about modern Chinese cooking - including street food, family recipes, and restaurant dishes. I take a less labor-intensive approach while maintaining the taste and look of the dish. I am originally from Beijing, and now cook from my New York kitchen.

@graph.name: Sichuan Shrimp Stir Fry
@graph.description: Authentic Chinese restaurant-style Sichuan shrimp is quick enough for a weeknight meal and delivers a crispy texture and richly aromatic, utterly divine flavor with that signature Sichuan spice.
recipeIngredient: 1 lb (450 g) shrimp (, peeled and deveined)
1/3 cup vegetable oil ((or enough to cover the shrimp halfway ) (*Footnote 2))
1  green onion (, whites minced, greens sliced for garnish)

recipeInstructions.text: Pat the shrimp dry with paper towels and transfer them to a medium-sized bowl. Add the light soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, and cornstarch. Toss to coat well. Marinate for 15 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Pat the shrimp dry with paper towels and transfer them to a medium-sized bowl. Add the light soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, and cornstarch. Toss to coat well. Marinate for 15 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the chilis into 1/2” pieces and place in a colander that has holes big enough to have the chili seeds fall through. Shimmy the colander above a big plate to separate some of the seeds from the chilis. Set aside the deseeded chilis for the cooking and discard the seeds.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut the chilis into 1/2” pieces and place in a colander that has holes big enough to have the chili seeds fall through. Shimmy the colander above a big plate to separate some of the seeds from the chilis. Set aside the deseeded chilis for the cooking and discard the seeds.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add the shrimp. Let cook without moving for 1 to 2 minutes, until the bottom turns golden. Flip to cook the other side for another 1 to 2 minutes, until turning golden and the shrimp are fully curled up. Transfer the shrimp to a big plate and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add the shrimp. Let cook without moving for 1 to 2 minutes, until the bottom turns golden. Flip to cook the other side for another 1 to 2 minutes, until turning golden and the shrimp are fully curled up. Transfer the shrimp to a big plate and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Turn to low heat. Remove all but 2 tablespoons of oil from the pan by pouring the oil into a bowl, or use a few layers of paper towels held in a pair of tongs to wipe the pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Turn to low heat. Remove all but 2 tablespoons of oil from the pan by pouring the oil into a bowl, or use a few layers of paper towels held in a pair of tongs to wipe the pan.

recipeInstructions.text: Turn to medium-low heat. Add the garlic, ginger, and green onion. Cook and stir until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Turn to medium-low heat. Add the garlic, ginger, and green onion. Cook and stir until fragrant, about 30 seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the doubanjiang. Stir and cook for a minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the doubanjiang. Stir and cook for a minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the dried chilis, sichuan peppercorns, and peanuts. Continue to cook and stir for another minute, or until the chilis turn dark brown but are not burned.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the dried chilis, sichuan peppercorns, and peanuts. Continue to cook and stir for another minute, or until the chilis turn dark brown but are not burned.

recipeInstructions.text: Add back the shrimp. Toss thoroughly to coat well. Immediately transfer everything to a serving plate.
recipeInstructions.name: Add back the shrimp. Toss thoroughly to coat well. Immediately transfer everything to a serving plate.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve hot over steamed rice as a main dish. (*Footnote 3)
recipeInstructions.name: Serve hot over steamed rice as a main dish. (*Footnote 3)
